# windowToolbar

**Type Property**

The placement for the containing window’s toolbar, sometimes referred to as the titlebar.

## Declaration

```swift
static var windowToolbar: ToolbarPlacement { get }
```

## Discussion

When hidden using [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/toolbar(_:for:)], this hides the entire window toolbar, including the title and “traffic light” window controls. To remove the custom toolbar item content only, use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarPlacement/automatic].

Use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/toolbarBackground(_:for:)] to hide the background of the window toolbar.

## Getting placements

- **automatic**: The primary toolbar.
- **accessoryBar(id:)**: Creates a unique accessory bar placement.
- **bottomBar**: The bottom toolbar of an app.
- **bottomOrnament**: The bottom ornament of an app.
- **navigationBar**: The navigation bar of an app.
- **tabBar**: The tab bar of an app.
